titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Marie Walsh Papers AIA.034
titlestmt.author: Rebecca Altermatt

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-01-21 15:33:25 -0500.

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

did.abstract: The collection contains correspondence from Marie Walsh to editors of the New York Times and members of Congress including Daniel Moynihan and Joseph Biden. Letters to the former discuss media coverage of activities of the IRA by the American press while those to Congress deal with Ms. Walsh's opposition to the Supplementary Extradition Treaty, eventually passed during the Reagan Administration. Other materials include an article authored by Ms. Walsh on the originations of Sinn Fein and proceedings from a conference held at Columbia University in 1994 on the MacBride Principles.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Marie Walsh Papers; AIA 034; box number; folder number; Archives of Irish America, Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Marie Walsh in 1999. The accession number associated with this gift is 1997.034.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Marie Walsh, the creator of this collection, were transferred to New York University in 1999. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from the Tamiment Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection contains correspondence from Marie Walsh to editors of the New York Times and members of Congress including Daniel Moynihan and Joseph Biden. Letters to the former discuss media coverage of activities of the IRA by the American press while those to Congress deal with Ms. Walsh's opposition to the Supplementary Extradition Treaty, eventually passed during the Reagan Administration. Other materials include an article authored by Ms. Walsh on the originations of Sinn Fein and proceedings from a conference held at Columbia University in 1994 on the MacBride Principles.

did.unittitle: Association of Catholic Trade Unionists (includes newsletter issues)
Gaelic League (Irish Language League; includes sheet music)
"MacBride Principles Fair Employment Practices in Northern Ireland: A Status Report" Comptroller of the City of New York.
